channel.title: Help help makeing an no-ip serevr
channel.description:
does any one know how i can make my no-ip work , i have created a no-ip adress and i have downloaded the no-ip DUC. When i open the DUC the box is already ticked it then says it has updated and the face smiles , then I untick it (is this right) and close the DUC. can sm1 help?? btw am i supposed to open any ports?? if i do wich ones ??
when i put my server up and tell my no-ip to everypne they say it dont work??? *Picture contained server IP.[br][br][size=1]Posted on: November 13, 2008, 09:49:38 am[/size][hr]plzz help

item.title: Help help makeing an no-ip serevr
item.dc:creator: @verbios verbios
item.description:
@verbios wrote:

Make sure you properly port-forwarded, and as freakinlost said, make sure you have your firewall enabled to allow incoming connections on the specified port.

All of these steps are explained clearly here.

Read full topic
item.source: Help help makeing an no-ip serevr

item.title: Help help makeing an no-ip serevr
item.dc:creator: @Kalphiter Kalphiter
item.description:
@Kalphiter wrote:

Ummmmm… don’t untick it, but you can close it it will still be running.

Read full topic
item.source: Help help makeing an no-ip serevr

item.title: Help help makeing an no-ip serevr
item.dc:creator: @freakinlost freakinlost
item.description:
@freakinlost wrote:

go into your firewall section (security) on control pannel for me not to sure what you have but go to exceptions tab and add the port you want[br][br][size=1]Posted on: November 13, 2008, 11:12:46 am[/size][hr]if you need more help there should be a tut about it

Read full topic
item.source: Help help makeing an no-ip serevr

item.title: Help help makeing an no-ip serevr
item.dc:creator: @stuntscape stuntscape
item.description:
@stuntscape wrote:

[quote=“wmashda3000, post:2, topic:243409”]you will need to make your pc allow connection coming into the computer on the port of your server, which is probably 43594.[/quote] how i do that
